Reviews.Title: Great image
Reviews.Author: Mark B. Koenig
Reviews.Content: This camera has a great image and is much better than the cheaper camera that came in the kit I bought. The only issues I have with this camera is that it requires you to manually focus, zoom and move position.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the added expense over the 420TVL
Reviews.Author: R. Perry
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to add to my outside cameras and general daytime performance is fine though not much different than the 420TVL.  The added features over the 420TVL, including zoom, focus, more IR LEDs, aren't worth the extra cost to me.  First, zoom is so small a range that it isn't worthwhile.  I have the camera looking at my driveway and there was very little difference in the captured frame with zoom at either end of its range.  Second, focus only is needed if  you change the zoom setting.  Finally the addd IR LEDs may help if the area is totally dark and there isn't anything nearby in frame but I leave the garage lights on and there is a car parked about 15' away.  The car causes a hazy flair in the middle of the display... Unless you are aiming this camera at an empty area in near total darkness at night, stick with the 420TVL.
